oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Summary: Letter sent from a camp near Knoxville, Tennessee informing Mary Black of a skirmish nearby which Hugh Black and his regiment fought in. oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from W. R. Pettes to A. B. Noyes, February 25, 1864
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Summary: W. R. Pettes informs A. B. Noyes that he received a telegram from the Confederate Secretary of Treasury C. G. Memminger that all duties must be paid in coin or sterling exchange starting February 17, 1864.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Customhouses--Florida--Saint Marks

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Diary excerpt of Hugh Black
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Black, Hugh, 1835-1915
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Confederate States of America. Army. Florida Infantry Regiment, 6th
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: www.american-south.org--Civil War in the American South
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Use of this item is provided for non-commercial, personal, educational, and research use only. For information about the copyright and reproduction rights for this item, please contact Special Collections, Florida State University Libraries, Tallahassee, Florida.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Summary: Diary entry in which Captain Black chronicles his campaign throughout the southern United States between June 12th and October 11th. Pages one and two are missing; the diary entry begins on page three. Part of the Captain Hugh Black Papers, MSS 1964-022.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Florida--History--Civil War, 1861-1865
